page.title: 19Hartshill Church
page.content: The parish church at Hartshill is called Holy Trinity Church.A windmill stood on the land for many years, but was demolished to make way for the church. Herbert Minton gave the money for the church to be built.He was a pottery manufacturer in Stoke.Inside the church on the floor and on the walls there are tiles which were made by Herbert Minton.No other church has tiles like this.The first service was held on 10th October 1842.Herbert Minton is buried in the chancel.The church was designed by Sir George Gilbert Scott.It has a tall spire.In the vestry is a stained glass window in memory of Clive of India and his family. The church plays a full part in the community with a thriving Sunday School and Brownies and Guides etc.
